intro: Cyclodium serra, commonly known as the serrated cyclodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a circular pattern. Cyclodium serra is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
